properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 5:58PM EST until January 16 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Southwest
Lower Michigan...

Grand River at Lansing affecting Ingham County
Grand River at Ionia affecting Ionia County
Grand River at Lowell affecting Kent County
Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County
Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County
Looking Glass River Near Eagle affecting Clinton County
Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County
Kalamazoo River At Marshall affecting Calhoun County
Portage River near Vicksburg affecting Kalamazoo County
St Joseph River At Burlington affecting Calhoun County

...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Southwest
Lower Michigan...

Grand River at Jackson affecting Jackson County
Grand River At Eaton Rapids affecting Eaton County
Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County
Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County
Thornapple River Above Hastings affecting Barry County
Kalamazoo River At Comstock affecting Kalamazoo County

.Multiple inches of rain have fallen across much of West Michigan
in the last 24 hours. This water will now be finding its way into
the rivers over the next few days and will lead to significant
increases in water levels. Minor flooding is now expected on the Grand
River all the way down to Lowell, as well as some of the more
flood-prone areas around Comstock Park and Robinson Township.
Flooding is also expected along parts of the Kalamazoo River and
some of the tributaries of both of these large rivers. Additional
precipitation this evening will be falling as freezing rain,
sleet, or snow, and will limit how much additional water is able
to start flowing into the rivers. The following forecast is based on
observed and forecast 48 hour precipitation.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Grand River at Ionia.
* from late Sunday night to Thursday morning.
* at  4:45 PM Saturday the stage was 16.2 feet.
* Flood stage is 21.0 feet.
* Minor Flooding is forecast.
* Forecast, rise above flood stage by Monday morning and continue to
rise to near 21.6 feet by Monday evening. The river will fall below
flood stage by Wednesday evening.
* Impact, at 21.0 feet...Expect minor flooding of several buildings
in the Ionia Fairgrounds, a shopping mall near the Fairgrounds, and
several businesses and residences in the southern portion of Ionia.
* Flood history, this crest compares to a previous crest of 21.8 feet
on Apr 13 2013.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Motorists should not attempt to drive around
barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.

Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local
radio... television... or NOAA Weather Radio station for further
information.

Additional weather and river information can be found on our homepage
at www.weather.gov/grr
